summary: Email correspondence between attorney Gloria Allred and Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene regarding arrangements for Epstein victims to attend or listen to Ghislaine Maxwell's bail hearing on July 14, 2020. Allred represents multiple Epstein victims, including Erika Braukis, who plan to attend, and reveals she has been retained by additional victims who allege victimization by Maxwell but are not yet willing to speak to prosecutors.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with prosecutors to secure access for her clients (Epstein victims) to observe Ghislaine Maxwell's bail hearing.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York coordinating victim access to the bail hearing and seeking to interview new victims.

persons.name: Erika Braukis
persons.context: Client of Gloria Allred who decided to fly in to attend the video hearing of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail proceeding.

persons.name: Wendy Olsen
persons.context: Prosecutor initially contacted by Gloria Allred regarding hearing access; forwarded the inquiry to Maurene.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming bail hearing; referenced as allegedly victimizing some of Allred's clients.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose victims are represented by Gloria Allred; his victims are seeking to observe Maxwell's hearing.

connections.description: Allred is representing Braukis, an Epstein victim, in connection with observing Maxwell's bail hearing.
Attorney and prosecutor corresponding about victim access to court proceedings and potential victim interviews.
Maxwell is facing charges related to Epstein's sex trafficking scheme; Allred states some of her clients allege victimization by both.
Allred represents victims who allege victimization by Maxwell, though not necessarily during the time frame of the indictment.
Colleagues in the U.S. Attorney's Office; Olsen forwarded Allred's initial inquiry to Maurene.

events.title: Bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Scheduled bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell, conducted via video with limited public audio access due to COVID-19.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, 6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048
Jury assembly room (courthouse location for video feed)
keyFacts: Gloria Allred represents multiple victims of Jeffrey Epstein, some of whom also allege victimization by Ghislaine Maxwell.
Allred reveals she has been retained by additional Epstein victims who are not yet willing to speak to prosecutors.
Victim Erika Braukis planned to attend Maxwell's bail hearing in person with a support person, requiring special seating arrangements.
Access to the bail hearing audio was limited, with a separate line for victims covered by the indictment, causing concern for other victims.
The correspondence highlights logistical challenges for victim access to court proceedings during the COVID-19 pandemic.
